document_data.name: Tabarast
document_data.titles: Tabarast of the Three Sung Curses
document_data.mainbody: '''Tabarast''' was a sage of the 8{{th}} century [[DR]]. He was sometimes an actor, too.
document_data.Personality:
Tabarast and [[Beldrune]] sometimes got into sesquipedalian talk, using long or old words.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|596-597|6}} The two were known to flirt with each other.

Tabarast was openly skeptical of the gods. He could sure drink a lot.
document_data.Activities:
In {{yearlink|761}}, they had spent years at [[Moonshorn Tower]], studying old [[magic]].{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|581-586|5}}

In {{yearlink|767}}, they were selling entry to their magic classes for a [[gold piece]] per attendant.
document_data.Description: Tabarast was balding, with no hair on his head left, and wore round spectacles. He was bearded.
document_data.Abilities:
He wasn't a great rider.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|591-592|5}}

One of Tabarast's spells, which had a [[material component]], created a spear of force that appeared as nothingness that was capable of tearing a man apart. The force of it was enough to nail them to a surface afterwards.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|624-625|9}}
document_data.Possessions: At [[Moonshorn Tower]], Tabarast carried a jar of [[Halavan nuts]], which he treasured.
document_data.Relationships: Tabarast and Beldrune had long worked together; Tabarast was the elder of the two.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|605-606|7}}
